result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darrin L Mitchell

records.addlTxt: Def appeal was GRANTED by Judge Hyland. LVM to call Collections Clerk for further instructions.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Appeal of Eligibility Determination for Appoint of Counsel
Defendant not eligible for court appointed counsel through Dane County - income over established guideline.

10:45 AM Defendant Darrin L Mitchell in court.  Prosecuting attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant indicated they do not qualify for SPD and has not yet retained counsel, requested adjournment. No objection.
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
Status conference on November 28, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
Defendant called Collections today to apply for county appointed attorney -  to mail  completed Petition for Counsel, bring along SPD Financial Eligibility Worksheet and provide most recent paystub.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards Darrin M Jr.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 14

1:51 PM Defendant Darrin L Mitchell in court, in custody.  Attorney Kathleen Chung in court for Darrin L Mitchell.  Prosecuting attorney Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on October 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
